media.caption: Esther Bubley self-portrait, circa 1950. Copyright Jean B. Bubley. Wikipedia

text.headline: Esther Bubley: In Transit
text.text:
Esther Bubley (Feb. 16, 1921-Mar. 16, 1998) was a pioneering female photographer during the golden age of photojournalism. After getting her start documenting the home front for the Office of War Information, she became a successful freelance photographer on assignment to magazines such as Life and Ladies Home Journal, and corporate clients like the Chicago, Burlington & Quincy Railroad Company. Bubley's work, celebrated for capturing intimate views of everyday life in the mid-20th century, is in the permanent collections of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Museum of Modern Art, and the National Portrait Gallery.

To commemorate the 100th anniversary of Bubley's birth, the Newberry has created this map featuring some of our favorites from her work for CB&Q.

Images from: Chicago, Burlington & Quincy Railroad Company Records, Series A-5-1: Granger Country Photographs, 1947-1948. Newberry Library  View at Internet Archive  |  Background: Map of the Chicago, Burlington and Quincy R.R., 1879. Library of Congress  View online

Help with historical scholarship! Create or review transcriptions to make handwritten letters and diaries easier to find, search, and browse. Start now at Newberry Transcribe
